title: SHFE Aluminum Hits New Yearly High in Night Session, Aluminum Prices Continue to Fluctuate at Highs
source: SMM Aluminum Morning Meeting Minutes via metal.com
summary: SHFE aluminum prices reached a new yearly high during the night session, with prices expected to trade between 21,300-21,900 yuan/mt next week. Despite environmental restrictions impacting production, supply changes are expected to be small, while demand may weaken next month. Inventory pressure is rising as the peak season ends, but overall macro sentiment remains optimistic with aluminum prices fluctuating at high levels.

title: Aluminum Rises to Over 3-Year High Amid Tight Supply and China's Production Cap
summary: Aluminum futures in the UK rose to $2,915 per tonne, the highest in over three years, driven by tight supply and China's commitment to preventing overcapacity with an annual output cap of 45 million tons. Prices rose 0.45% to $2,856.95 USD/T on November 7, 2025, with forecasts expecting prices to reach $2,918.78 USD/T by the end of the quarter and $3,053.09 in 12 months.

title: Aluminum Prices Reach Highest Level Since May 2022
summary: Aluminum futures on the London Metal Exchange rose 0.6% to $2,902 a metric ton, marking the highest price since May 2022. The rally is driven by tightening supply in China due to state-imposed production caps and an improving demand outlook amid easing US-China trade tensions. Despite positive momentum, risks remain from slowing manufacturing activity in China.

title: LME Week: US Aluminum Price Rise Spurs Deliveries from Canada
summary: Rising US aluminum prices have encouraged increased deliveries from Canada, though trade flows have not yet reached full pace. The London Metal Exchange price is around $2,750 a ton, with the US Midwest premium hitting a record $1,697 a ton, reflecting tariffs and costs. Canadian exports to the US have declined year-on-year, while deliveries to Europe have surged, influencing premiums and stock levels in the US market.

title: Aluminum Eases from 3-Year High
summary: Aluminum prices rose to $2,856.95 per tonne on November 7, 2025, up 0.45% from the previous day, after reaching a three-year high of $2,900 in late October. Supply pressures include suspension of one potline at Iceland's Grundartangi smelter due to equipment failure and Alcoa's announcement to shut its Kwinana alumina refinery in Australia due to deteriorating bauxite grades. Chinese smelters face challenges building new plants amid higher energy costs and regulations, while demand remains supported by electrification sectors and improving US-China trade relations.

title: Macro sentiment is strong at home and abroad, and aluminium prices continue to fluctuate at highs
summary: Domestic aluminum production in China increased by 1.13% year-over-year in October 2025, with aluminum ingot inventory slightly rising to 622,000 tonnes. Despite limited fundamental drivers, optimistic macroeconomic conditions both domestically and internationally support aluminum prices fluctuating at high levels. SHFE aluminum is expected to trade between 21,300-21,900 yuan per tonne, while LME aluminum is forecasted between USD 2,830-2,930 per tonne.

title: US aluminum scrap trade faces 2025 shake-up amid tariffs and global demand
summary: The US aluminum scrap trade experienced significant changes in early 2025 due to new import tariffs and shifting global demand. Imports of aluminum scrap rose 31% in the first half of 2025 compared to the previous year, despite a 25% import tariff implemented in March. This tariff led recyclers to increasingly rely on domestic scrap recovery rather than foreign imports.

title: Alcoa, Ball and Unilever Partner to Launch the First Use of ELYSIS Carbon-Free Smelting Technology in Consumer Packaging
summary: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever have collaborated to introduce ELYSIS carbon-free aluminum smelting technology in consumer personal and home care packaging. This partnership aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and promote sustainable aluminum production, aligning with global decarbonization goals and growing consumer demand for low-carbon products.

title: Alcoa (AA) Soars as Aluminum Prices Hit 17-Month High Amidst Green Energy Boom
summary: Aluminum prices surged to over $2,900 per tonne in late October and early November 2025, driven by increased demand linked to the green energy sector. This price rise has positively impacted Alcoa's stock, reflecting optimism about the aluminum market's growth prospects amid global energy transitions.

title: Alcoa, Ball and Unilever Partner to Launch the First Use of ELYSIS Carbon-Free Smelting Technology in Consumer Personal and Home Care Packaging
summary: Alcoa, Ball Corporation, and Unilever have collaborated to launch the first consumer packaging using ELYSIS carbon-free aluminum smelting technology, marking a significant step toward decarbonizing the aluminum sector. This innovation combines higher recycled content with low-carbon primary aluminum, showcasing cross-industry collaboration for sustainable manufacturing.

title: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever Pioneer Carbon-Free Aluminum in Consumer Packaging
summary: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever have introduced the world’s first consumer personal and home care packaging made with ELYSIS carbon-free aluminum, leveraging inert anode technology to eliminate greenhouse gas emissions from smelting. The project highlights how supply chain collaboration can accelerate low-carbon innovation and support global climate goals.

title: Pioneering Sustainable Practices Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever Lead with Carbon-Free Smelting Technology
summary: Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever are leading the way in sustainable aluminum technology by deploying ELYSIS carbon-free smelting for consumer packaging. This initiative demonstrates how material innovation and industry collaboration can drive tangible sustainability benefits and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Steel prices fall slightly amid ongoing market adjustments
summary: Steel prices fell to 3,034 CNY/T on November 7, 2025, down 0.16% from the previous day. Over the past month, steel prices have declined by 1.97% and are down 6.07% compared to the same time last year. The price is expected to trade at 3,039.40 Yuan/MT by the end of the quarter and 2,904.76 Yuan/MT in 12 months.

title: HRC Steel prices show modest decline but remain up year-on-year
summary: HRC Steel traded flat at 847 USD/T on November 7, 2025, down 0.35% from the previous day. Despite the slight daily drop, prices have risen 3.82% over the past month and are up 19.39% compared to the same time last year. Forecasts expect HRC Steel to reach 864.45 USD/T by the end of the quarter and 934.57 USD/T in 12 months.

title: Europe heavy steel plate prices buoyed by CBAM cost pressures
summary: Domestic heavy steel plate prices in Europe remained strong in the week ending November 6, supported by the EU's impending Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) cost pressures. The market is also influenced by strong slab offers and a lack of imports, which are sustaining price levels.

title: Klöckner sharpens US focus as Americas segment delivers strong Q3
summary: Klöckner Metals Americas reported robust earnings in Q3 2025 despite softer steel prices, with shipments up 2.8% year-on-year. The company is selling eight US distribution sites to focus more on higher-value-added metal processing, aiming to reduce exposure to volatile commodity markets and increase service center business to 87% of sales.

title: Global iron and steel market shows relative stability in early November 2025
summary: The global iron and steel market during the first week of November 2025 reflected a relatively stable trend with minor increases in prices. Market dynamics indicate cautious optimism amid ongoing economic uncertainties.

title: U.S. Steel posts strong Q3 as Nippon centers it in global growth strategy
summary: U.S. Steel reported a 15% increase in net sales to $4.43 billion in Q3 2025, driven by strong performance in its Mini Mill and Tubular segments. Despite higher costs and weaker European demand reducing net income by 16% year over year to $100 million, the Mini Mill segment saw an 86% sales increase and improved margins due to higher prices and contributions from Big River Steel.

title: Iron ore logs weekly loss on soft steel demand, production cuts in China
summary: Blast furnace production cuts in North China, a major steelmaking region, have led to a decline in steel output, contributing to a weekly loss in iron ore prices. The reduced steel demand and production adjustments reflect ongoing challenges in the Chinese steel sector.

title: China will promote value-added steel production
summary: China's annual steel production is expected to fall below 1 billion tons for the first time in six years by the end of 2025, driven by declining demand. The country plans to focus on promoting value-added steel production to adapt to changing market conditions and improve product quality.

title: USWC's Rare November Bulk Scrap Cargo Sale to Turkey
summary: The U.S. West Coast (USWC) sold a rare bulk scrap cargo to Turkey amid disruptions in Asian scrap markets, creating a unique arbitrage opportunity. Turkey remains a major scrap importer with strong demand for premium scrap grades, benefiting from geographic advantages and electric arc furnace technology adoption.

title: Europe heavy steel plate prices buoyed by CBAM cost pressures and strong slab offers
summary: Domestic heavy steel plate prices in Europe remained strong due to the EU's upcoming Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) and limited imports. Cost pressures and robust slab offers have supported price levels in the European steel plate market.

title: Green steel revolution: navigating a new frontier in 2025
summary: Sweden is set to produce the world's first zero-carbon emission steel in 2025, marking a historic milestone for the industry. The shift to green steel, driven by hydrogen-based direct reduction iron and scrap-based electric arc furnace technologies, will reshape pricing, markets, and supply chains, though challenges remain around energy costs and infrastructure.

title: Coarse Particle Flotation: Mining Recovery Revolution
summary: Coarse particle flotation (CPF) technology is transforming mineral processing by enabling efficient recovery of valuable minerals from larger particles, improving sustainability and operational efficiency in mining. The technology reduces energy and water use, minimizes tailings, and is gaining rapid adoption across major mining operations.

title: Copper Prices Decline on Fed Uncertainty and Supply Relief
summary: Copper prices dropped as much as 2.4% amid uncertainty over US Federal Reserve policy and eased global supply concerns, with three-month copper trading around $10,855 per tonne on the LME. The shift in focus from US-China trade tensions to Fed rate outlook and China's economic slowdown has contributed to the decline, despite copper still being up more than 20% year-to-date due to earlier mine disruptions.

title: Copper Price Falls on Fed Policy, Codelco Supply
summary: Copper extended losses as renewed uncertainty over US interest rates and positive production signals from Chile's Codelco eased supply fears, with LME three-month copper around $10,855/tonne and COMEX near $5.013/lb. The US dollar's strength and mixed signals from Fed officials further pressured prices, though copper remains up over 20% in 2025.

title: Copper Set for Weekly Drop
summary: Copper futures steadied around $4.95/lb but were set for a weekly loss amid a global risk-off mood, weak Chinese trade data, and speculation about Beijing curbing copper refining overcapacity. Concerns over AI valuations and a prolonged US government shutdown added to the cautious market sentiment.

title: Copper Strengthens as Trade Tensions Ease
summary: Copper prices rose on Friday, supported by signs of easing trade tensions between major economies, providing some relief after recent declines driven by Fed uncertainty and supply dynamics.

title: Lundin Mining Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results and Increases Full-Year Copper Production Guidance and Lowers Cost Guidance
summary: Lundin Mining reported strong third-quarter 2025 results, with copper production, revenue, EBITDA, and earnings exceeding previous quarters. The company increased its full-year copper production guidance to a midpoint of 328,000 tonnes and lowered its consolidated copper cash cost guidance to $1.85–$2.00/lb.

title: Vedanta Resources Launches CopperTech Metals to Bolster U.S. Copper Security and Advance Technology and Infrastructure Transformation
summary: Vedanta Resources launched CopperTech Metals, a U.S.-domiciled company focused on expanding copper production from the Konkola Copper Mines in Zambia. The company plans to increase production from 140,000 tonnes in FY26 to 300,000 tonnes by 2031, with ambitions to reach 500,000 tonnes annually, leveraging advanced mining and AI-driven technologies.

title: CopperTech Metals Launch: High-Grade Mining Investment
summary: CopperTech Metals launched with a focus on high-grade copper mining assets in Zambia, boasting ore grades of 2.9–3.3% copper, significantly above global averages. The company emphasizes integrated operations and advanced technology to maximize efficiency and profitability.

title: Maxus Mining Announces Closing of Flow Through Private Placement
summary: Maxus Mining closed a flow-through private placement, supporting exploration at its Penny Copper Project in British Columbia. The project has returned high copper values in grab samples, indicating potential for future copper production.

title: Copper Mining: Sustainability, Innovation, and ESG in 2025
summary: Copper demand is surging due to the global transition to clean energy and sustainable infrastructure. Rick Rule highlights copper's critical role in electrification efforts, renewable energy, and smart grid technologies, emphasizing responsible mining practices aligned with ESG standards. Innovations like AI drones and ESG technology are driving new copper discoveries, particularly in politically stable regions such as Chile, Peru, and the United States.

title: BHP's Copper Boom: Sustainable Mining to Meet Soaring Global Demand
summary: BHP reported record copper production reaching 2,017 thousand tonnes, an 8% increase from last year, driven by strong results at key assets like Escondida in Chile. The company is advancing sustainable mining practices, including the use of recycled copper, to support the global energy transition and urban development. BHP's strategy focuses on operational excellence and clean energy goals to meet rising copper demand over the next 30 years.

title: Dixie Gold Inc. Readies for a Tightening Copper Environment with the Soo East Copper Project
summary: Dixie Gold Inc. has acquired the Soo East Copper Project in Ontario, comprising 137 mining claims over approximately 3,013 hectares. This acquisition follows recent high-grade copper discoveries nearby and positions the company to capitalize on tightening copper supply conditions. The project aims to leverage exploration advances to meet growing copper demand sustainably.

title: CoTec to Host Investor Update
summary: CoTec Holdings Corp. is advancing innovative and environmentally sustainable technologies in mineral extraction to support a low-carbon future. The company focuses on recycling, waste mining, and scalable solutions to accelerate critical mineral production while reducing environmental impact. CoTec's approach aims to shorten development timelines and enhance sustainability in the metals and minerals industry.

title: Nickel fell to 15020 USD/T on November 7, 2025, down 0.23% from the previous day
summary: Nickel prices decreased to 15,020 USD per tonne on November 7, 2025, marking a 0.23% drop from the previous day. Over the past month, nickel prices fell by 2.40%, and are down 8.01% compared to the same time last year, reflecting ongoing oversupply concerns and muted momentum in the market.

title: Nickel Price Update: Q3 2025 in Review
summary: Nickel prices were volatile in the first half of 2025 but stabilized in Q3 amid ongoing oversupply driven mainly by rapid production growth in Indonesia. Despite rising consumption, the market remains structurally oversupplied, with LME nickel stockpiles increasing to 231,504 MT by the end of September 2025.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel prices fell sharply on November 5
summary: Nickel prices on the SHFE fell sharply on November 5, approaching 119,000 yuan/mt before a slight rebound. The US dollar index rose to a three-month high, impacting nickel prices, while China's central bank conducted significant liquidity operations to maintain banking system stability.

title: The world nickel market in 2025 – a growing surplus in an uncertain global landscape
summary: Global primary nickel production is projected to grow by 5.9% in 2025, contributing to a growing surplus amid record-high EV sales and rising stainless steel production. LME and SHFE nickel inventories have been rising steadily, surpassing 230,000 tonnes in early 2025, reflecting ongoing oversupply despite geopolitical uncertainties.

title: SMM News Flash: High-Nickel Pig Iron Prices Decline on November 8
summary: SMM reported that the price range for 8-12% high-nickel pig iron (ex-factory price) declined to 1005~1025 yuan/nickel on November 8, 2025. The drop reflects ongoing market pressures and subdued demand in the nickel sector.

title: Nickel Supply Woes: Innovations Steering a Sustainable EV Future
summary: This article discusses the critical role of nickel in battery technology for electric vehicles (EVs) and highlights innovations such as low-nickel or nickel-free battery chemistries, advanced battery recycling, and smaller battery sizes to ensure sustainability. It also emphasizes financial incentives and policies like the U.S. Inflation Reduction Act and the EU’s Battery Fund to boost domestic battery production and mining capacities.

title: Genomines raises $45M to grow nickel from plants, not mines
summary: French start-up Genomines secured $45 million in funding to scale its innovative method of extracting nickel using plants that hyperaccumulate metals from soil. This approach offers a faster, more cost-effective, and environmentally friendly alternative to traditional mining by harvesting nickel-rich biomass from non-arable land.

title: Greening nickel extraction requires institutional and financial support
summary: The article highlights the environmental challenges of nickel mining, particularly the greenhouse gas emissions from clearing carbon-rich forests. It stresses the need for institutional and financial backing to scale up low-carbon nickel extraction technologies to reduce the industry's carbon footprint.

title: Italy's Tenaris posts surprise 2% rise in sales on stable US, Canada drilling activity
summary: Italian steel pipe maker Tenaris reported a 2% increase in third-quarter net sales to $2.98 billion, driven by stable drilling activity in North America which offset weakness in other regions. The company warned that margins will be affected by the full impact of tariff costs, while sales in Europe and Argentina were weaker due to lower drilling activity and North Sea sales.

title: Tenaris Announces 2025 Third Quarter Results
summary: Tenaris S.A. announced its financial results for the third quarter ended September 30, 2025, confirming a rise in net sales and providing insights into the impact of tariffs and regional market conditions on its performance.

title: Tenaris S.A. Current Report (Foreign Issuer) - Buyback Agreement
summary: Tenaris entered a non-discretionary buyback agreement starting November 3, 2025, extending until April 30, 2026, indicating strategic financial management amid market conditions.

title: Prysmian Awarded The Italy-Tunisia Interconnection
summary: Prysmian has been awarded a tender by Terna S.p.A. and STEG for the construction of a submarine power interconnection between Italy and Tunisia as part of the Elmed Project. The contract could reach a value of around €460 million and aims to create an energy bridge between Europe and Africa, enhancing energy security and supporting cleaner energy transitions.

title: Prysmian lifts 2025 outlook after Q3 beat on strong transmission growth
summary: Prysmian SpA raised its full-year 2025 guidance after reporting third-quarter revenue of €5.03 billion, exceeding expectations. The company showed strong organic growth in Renewable Transmission (39%) and Power Grids (15%), supported by solid performance in Europe and North America, with a stable high-voltage backlog of about €16 billion.
